title: Small claims: Whose responsibility is it to record Satisfaction of Judgment with County Recorder––debtor or creditor?
question: I am the judgment creditor in a small claims case. I recorded the Abstract of Judgment with the county recorder in the counties in which the judgment debtor owns real property, creating a judgment lien against these properties. I recently received satisfaction of judgment in full and will file form EJ-100 with the court very shortly.
answers: You file the satisfaction of judgment with the court. To expedite things ou CAN and SHOULD file the satisfaction with the County Recorder. Yes, there is a fee associated with this, however, you do not want to be caught not complying with the legal obligations. However, you can require that the debtor file and pay the recording fee.
You sign it. The debtor records it, and pays the recording fees.
You have an obligation to file a satisfaction with the court and also give the debtor a notarized satisfaction. Recording it is the debtor's burden.
